channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Two washing machines, 13th June
item.description:
Two washing machines outside 188, Great Titchfield St. REPORTED THIS TWO DAYS AGO

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Great Titchfield Street, Fitzrovia, Camden Town, City of Westminster

item.title: Bins, 13th June
item.description:
I’m writing to you within a month of the fact that your staff are stupid if you take a bin of someone’s property you put it back in the same place. It doesn’t take more than two seconds not leave it thrown on the pavement for people to trip over it and people to know that we are out of work to Rob our houses.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stembridge Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Plastic roadworks barriers on pavement, 13th June
item.description:
Two yellow plastic roadworks barriers have been abandoned following work to a nearby metal bollard and are currently leaning against the wall of a property at the junction of Alexandra Road with Lennard Road. They keep falling over and partially blocking the pavement. Please remove.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lennard Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southover, Sundridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pedestrian Crossing at Prince of Wales and Castlehaven roads, 13th June
item.description:
The pedestrian crossing beep form the Accessible Pedestrian Signal on the corners of Prince of Wales Road and Castlehaven Road has been set to a volume that is too loud and is a constant noise disturbance. This is undermining the living standards of residents living on this road, including those who work from home and those with young children. Since installation some two months ago, it sounds continuously during the day, including from early in the morning until late at night, and should be reviewed urgently. Other crossings in the road are silent and if necessary provide a tactile rotating signal for accessibility. Please can this noise be reduced materially reduced or better yet turned off completely. If the purpose is to aid those with visual impairment, let's recognise that they are not deaf! It is impacting the mental health of the residents in what is NOT a built up area. Assistance as soon as possible would be very much appreciated.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Castlehaven Road, Kentish Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin bags not collected and spilled into the road, 13th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 95, Boundary Road, Maida Vale, London

item.title: Three Bins have been dumped on Torr Road, 13th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Torr Road, Penge, London

item.title: Grafitti, 13th June
item.description:
Please see attached photo - graffiti on the side of the bridge. Although Bexley over the last few months seems to be taking a “not my problem” or “it’s not quite bad enough yet” approach to using our tax payer money to repair potholes damaging cars and remove flytipping on public footpaths, I’m reporting this anyway in the hope it gets sorted at some point.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westwood Lane, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Brambles and tree growth, 13th June
item.description:
From within Danson park brambles and shrubs are growing through the park railings, Some of the brambles are at face height and present a danger to pedestrians using the footpath between Lakeside Close and the sub station end of Wellan Close.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): East Rochester Way, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet
